stages.logText: A huge rat called Gruiik told you, that they drove all the people out of this village.
Some two-legs were running around in the garden again. You should kill them.
You told Gruiik, that you killed Mara and Tharal.
You lied to Gruiik, that you killed Mara and Tharal.
Gruiik was hungry and asked to bring him bread.
You found a bread in a bag hanging at the door of the Crossglen town hall.
You gave a bread to Gruiik.
The huge rat ignored you furthermore.
You woke up when you felt that something had bitten you in your toe. Apparently you had a nightmare - there were rats everywhere! Anyway, you were not a bit recovered.
You got the skull of a rat.
You took a leg bone of a rat from a gold hunter.
You stole a leg bone of a rat from the instrument maker.
You found a leg bone of a  rat in the center of a labyrinth.
You took a leg bone of a rat from the dancing skeletons.
You found the tail bones of a dead rat on a platform in a lake.
You found the back bone of a dead rat.
A small, naughty rat claimed that it could help you get out of here. In return, it required you to help to find a yellow, round artifact.
In the deep of the cave you found a new statue, that resembles to your brother Andor.
The rats had build up the statue of Andor in memory that he never killed them. You should begin your search behind this statue.
You would need a pickaxe to tear down the statue.
Audir, the smith of Crossglen, gave you an old, sturdy pickaxe.
You tore down the statue of Andor. Behind it in the wall you found a hole in the shape of a bone.
You put a bone into the hole, and the wall crumbled to dust.
A torch helped you to see in the dark. Unfortunately, the torch is so heavy, that you have to lift it with both hands.
You found a platform from which you have a good view over Crossglen. Andor seemed to have been here many times.

You found an exit from the caves to the surface. Cold icy wind was swirling up here on the Black Water mountain top.
Astonishingly you are not alone here - Whootibarfag, a very old eremit seemed to have awaited me.
Wart, the warden to the halls of memory told me, that the access would be closed, until the rat memorial is restored. I should seek the bones of King Rah's skeleton.
Wart was glad to have his rat memorial restored. He granted access now.
Wart told you that Fraedro was captured.
Wart allowed you to go deeper into the cave.
You attack Fraedro to avenge the theft of King Rah.
You finally found the yellow artifact: It was a big, smelly cheese - almost everlasting. Clevred was overjoyed!
You fought your way through the roundlings. But Clevred was seriously wounded. He was just able to give you his beloved artifact. With a last breath he thanked for your company and died in your arms.
You persuaded Clevred to leave the artifact behind. He left you disappointedly then.
Back in your home you fell asleep. When you woke up, all the rats were gone! Was it only a dream?

Roskelt, the leader of a gang of skeletons, claimed to be king of the caves. He demanded that you would seek out his brother and bring him a message: if he came and surrendered, then he would have the grace of a quick, almost painless death.

Bloskelt, the leader of a gang of skeletons, claimed to be king of the caves. He demanded that you would seek out his brother and bring him a message: if he came and surrendered, then he would have the grace of a quick, almost painless death.
Bloskelt, a leader of another gang of skeletons, also claimed to be king of the caves. You delivered Roskelt's message, but earned nothing but laughter.
Roskelt, a leader of another gang of skeletons, also claimed to be king of the caves. You delivered Bloskelt's message, but earned nothing but laughter.
Roskelt asked you to kill his brother.
Bloskelt asked you to kill his brother.
For your effort, you got a pretty poor reward.
